reg:regulation.reg:title:
Exempt Projects, Programs, Contracts
and Expenditures Regulation
reg:regulation.reg:amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 227/2011, December 8, 2011]

bcl:definition.bcl:text: Act means the Clean Energy Act;
FK Project has the same meaning as in the AltaGas Northwest Projects Umbrella Agreement;
Mclymont Project has the same meaning as in the AltaGas Northwest Projects Umbrella Agreement;
Volcano Project has the same meaning as in the AltaGas Northwest Projects Umbrella Agreement.

bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of sections 7 and 8 of the Act, the Northwest Transmission Line is further described as including the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the AltaGas Northwest Projects Umbrella Agreement;
287 kilovolt transmission circuits and related facilities between the authority's substation at Skeena and the substation referred to in paragraph (c);

the following activities related to the substation, facilities and equipment referred to in paragraph (c) and the circuits and facilities referred to in paragraph (d), whether or not the substation or circuits are completed or put into service:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: acquiring or holding rights-of-way, permits, licences, certificates, consents and other authorizations;
negotiating, entering into and carrying out agreements with First Nations;

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Agreements with pulp and paper customers
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of sections 7 and 8 of the Act, the agreements with pulp and paper customers eligible for funding under Canada's Green Transformation Program are further described as including the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: electricity purchasing agreements, under which the authority may acquire, in aggregate, up to 1 200 gigawatt hours per year of energy;
customer-funded project agreements, under which customers agree to implement energy efficiency projects without an incentive payment from the authority;
umbrella agreements that create a contractual link between the agreements referred to in paragraphs (a), (b) and (c).

bcl:section.bcl:text: The authority is exempt from section 44.2 (2) of the Utilities Commission Act with respect to the agreements referred to in section 3 (b) of this regulation.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Clean Energy Act, S.B.C. 2010, c. 22, section 37]
